item.title: Home Wrecker
item.dc:creator: Ocean Vuong
item.description: And this is how we danced: with our mothers’ white dresses spilling from our feet, late August

item.title: Trevor
item.dc:creator: Ocean Vuong
item.description: Are you Trevor’s eyes: the blue shafts in a gutted mine?

item.title: Aubade With Burning City
item.dc:creator: Ocean Vuong
item.description: Milkflower petals on the street/like pieces of a girl’s dress.

item.title: Prayer for the Newly Damned
item.dc:creator: Ocean Vuong
item.description: Dearest Father, forgive me for I have seen. Behind the wooden fence, a field lit

item.title: Telemachus
item.dc:creator: Ocean Vuong
item.description: Like any good son, I pull my father out of the water, drag him by his hair

item.title: Untitled (Blue, Green, & Brown): oil on canvas: Mark Rothko: 1952
item.dc:creator: Ocean Vuong
item.description: The TV said the planes have hit the buildings./& I said Yes because you asked me to stay.

item.title: Poet's Sampler: Ocean Vuong
item.dc:creator: Ocean Vuong
item.description: You are standing in the minefield again. Someone who is dead now

item.title: Eurydice
item.dc:creator: Ocean Vuong
item.description: It’s more like the sound/a doe makes/when the arrowhead/replaces the day.
